descript.abstract:
The 64 knot, 120 hour cumulative wind speed probabilities show probabilities of sutained (1-minute average) surface (10-meter altitude) wind speeds equal to or exceeding 64 kt...74 mph (tropical storm force) at a regulary spaced (5 km) grid of points. The cumulative periods begin at the start ofthe forecast period and extend through the entire 5-day forecat period from 0-120 hours.
This shapefile was created by interpolating the requlary spaced 1/2 detree grid of points into a regularly spaced 5 km grid of points.
descript.purpose: These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the national level and for large regional areas. The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:2,000,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration in the use of these data.

idinfo.useconst: None. Acknowledgement of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Weather Service, National Centers for Environmental Prediction or the National Hurricane Center would be appreciated in products derived from these data.

cntperp.cntorg: National Hurricane Center / Technical Support Branch

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The 120 hour cumulative probability of surface (10-meter altitude) wind speeds in percent between 0 and 100.

distinfo.distliab: No responsibility is assumed by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration in the use of these data.
